docs.title: pyjpx-etf
docs.text: A clean, beginner-friendly Python library for fetching JPX ETF portfolio composition (PCF) data.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Simple API — yfinance-style ETF("1306") interface
  • No authentication — uses free, public PCF CSV endpoints
  • Lightweight — just requests and pandas
  • Auto provider detection — tries ICE Data Services, then Solactive

docs.title: Quick Example
docs.text:
import pyjpx_etf as etf

e = etf.ETF("1306")
print(e.info.name)       # "TOPIX ETF"
print(e.to_dataframe().head())

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: pip install pyjpx-etf

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: pip install pyjpx-etf

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
import pyjpx_etf as etf

e = etf.ETF("1306")

# ETF metadata
print(e.info.name)              # "TOPIX ETF"
print(e.info.cash_component)    # 496973797639.0
print(e.info.shares_outstanding)  # 8133974978
print(e.info.date)              # datetime.date(2026, 2, 27)

# Holdings
for h in e.holdings[:5]:
    print(f"{h.name}: {h.weight:.2%}")

# Full DataFrame
df = e.to_dataframe()

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
import pyjpx_etf as etf

etf.config.timeout = 60        # HTTP timeout in seconds
etf.config.request_delay = 0.5  # Delay between provider retries

docs.title: Data Sources
docs.text:
pyjpx-etf fetches PCF (Portfolio Composition File) CSVs from:

Provider Covers ICE Data Services Majority of TSE ETFs Solactive AG Global X Japan ETFs

Data is updated daily on business days, available 7:50–23:55 JST.

docs.title: pyjpx_etf.config
docs.text: Configuration for pyjpx-etf.

docs.title: Config dataclass
docs.text: Mutable configuration for HTTP requests.

docs.title: pyjpx_etf.config.Config dataclass
docs.text: Mutable configuration for HTTP requests.

docs.title: pyjpx_etf.ETF
docs.text:
Fetch and access JPX ETF portfolio composition data.

Data is lazy-loaded from PCF providers on first property access.

Usage::

import pyjpx_etf as etf

e = etf.ETF("1306")
e.info.name          # "TOPIX ETF"
e.holdings[:5]       # first 5 holdings
e.to_dataframe()     # pandas DataFrame

docs.title: to_dataframe()
docs.text: Return holdings as a pandas DataFrame.

docs.title: pyjpx_etf.PyJPXETFError
docs.text:
Bases: Exception

Base exception for all pyjpx-etf errors.

docs.title: pyjpx_etf.ETFNotFoundError
docs.text:
Bases: PyJPXETFError

Raised when the ETF code is not found on any provider.

docs.title: pyjpx_etf.FetchError
docs.text:
Bases: PyJPXETFError

Raised on network or HTTP errors.

docs.title: pyjpx_etf.ParseError
docs.text:
Bases: PyJPXETFError

Raised when CSV content cannot be parsed.

docs.title: The ETF Class
docs.text:
The ETF class is the main entry point. It lazily fetches data on first access.

import pyjpx_etf as etf

e = etf.ETF("1306")

docs.title: ETF Info
docs.text:
Access metadata via the info property:

e.info.code               # "1306"
e.info.name               # "TOPIX ETF"
e.info.cash_component     # Fund cash component
e.info.shares_outstanding # Shares outstanding
e.info.date               # Fund date as datetime.date

# Convert to dict
dict_info = e.info.to_dict()

docs.title: Holdings
docs.text:
Access constituent holdings:

for h in e.holdings:
    print(f"{h.code} {h.name}: {h.weight:.2%}")

Each Holding has: code, name, isin, exchange, currency, shares, price, weight.

docs.title: DataFrame Output
docs.text:
df = e.to_dataframe()
# Columns: code, name, isin, exchange, currency, shares, price, weight

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
from pyjpx_etf import ETFNotFoundError, FetchError, ParseError

try:
    e = etf.ETF("9999")
    _ = e.info
except ETFNotFoundError:
    print("ETF not found")
except FetchError:
    print("Network error")
